Major_Arcs.title: The Enigma of Ghost Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the mysterious setting of Ghost Town and the woman's perplexing arrival and attempts to explain her situation, setting up the initial mystery.

sub_scenes.title: Arrival and Unbelievable Explanations
sub_scenes.description: A woman in a green hat finds herself in Ghost Town and desperately tries to explain her impossible situation to various men, highlighting her urgency and frustration.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Explanations in Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Airport Development Threat
sub_scenes.description: The woman overhears plans to build an airport in Ghost Town, leading to her horrified confrontation with the men involved, revealing her deep connection to the town.

narrative_arcs.title: Discovery of Airport Plans and Confrontation in Ghost Town

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Tensions and Realizations
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the complex relationship between the woman (now identified as Nan) and Cal, their arguments, and Nan's emotional journey towards understanding Cal's affection and the deeper offer he intends to make.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Misunderstandings
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal discuss their relationship, clearing up misunderstandings about romantic expressions and affection, leading to a temporary reconciliation.

sub_scenes.title: The Real Offer and Work Site Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Cal dismisses their argument and leads Nan to a work site in the desert, where she encounters construction workers, setting up a new conflict and setting.

narrative_arcs.title: The Real Offer in the Blasted Desert
Arrival at the Work Site and Confrontation with Workers

Major_Arcs.title: Airport Business and Family Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to the practicalities of the airport development, focusing on horse transportation plans and introducing family conflicts within Nan's household, particularly concerning her father and his business dealings.

sub_scenes.title: Horse Transportation and Airport Logistics
sub_scenes.description: The focus shifts to a discussion about transporting horses for the airport construction, highlighting the business and logistical aspects of the development.

sub_scenes.title: Family Discord and Nan's Rebellion
sub_scenes.description: Nan's attempt to help the construction workers leads to conflict with her father, escalating into emotional turmoil and a sense of humiliation, revealing family tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Helping Construction Workers and Crazy Notions
Solace in Tears and Maid's Comfort

Major_Arcs.title: Advice, Confrontation, and Pursuit in Love
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc deals with Nan seeking advice on her relationship with Cal, leading to a direct confrontation and chase as Nan seeks clarity and commitment from him.

sub_scenes.title: Mother and Maid's Counsel
sub_scenes.description: Nan seeks comfort and advice from her mother and the maid regarding her relationship with Cal, receiving different perspectives on love and patience.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Advice on Love and Patience
Maid's Practical Advice and Cal's Love

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Desperate Chase for Clarity
sub_scenes.description: Driven by her need for answers, Nan confronts Cal and then chases after him on horseback, desperate to understand his feelings and intentions.

narrative_arcs.title: Desperate Chase and Plea for Attention

sub_scenes.title: Business Interruption and Deal Commitment
sub_scenes.description: The narrative briefly shifts back to business matters with a discussion about the horses and the airport deadline, before intertwining with Nan and Cal's personal issues.

narrative_arcs.title: Yore Dad's Deal and No Backing Down

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confession and Departure
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her deepest feelings to Cal, leading to a poignant moment of separation as Cal departs for work, leaving Nan to reflect on their relationship.

sub_scenes.title: Flashback Loneliness and Confession of Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Nan reflects on her loneliness during Cal's absence, followed by Cal's return and confession of pursuing her to finally express his feelings, leading to a romantic breakthrough.

Major_Arcs.title: Love, Weather Crisis, and Community Aid
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc combines the blossoming romance between Nan and Cal with a severe weather crisis, showcasing their love amidst hardship and the community's response to the snowstorm.

sub_scenes.title: Affection, Foreboding, and Grim Weather Report
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal express their affection, but a narrator hints at underlying tension. Mr. Wills arrives with a dire weather report, setting the stage for a community crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Snowfall and Decisive Action
sub_scenes.description: Narration describes the relentless snowfall, emphasizing the severity of the storm. Cal decides to take action to save the cattle, highlighting the dire stakes.

sub_scenes.title: Indoor Concern and Hopeful Rescue
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal discuss the worsening situation indoors, followed by the hopeful sound of a plane, which turns out to be delivering aid, bringing relief to the community.

narrative_arcs.title: Sound of Hope: Arrival of the Plane

Major_Arcs.title: Town Justice and Chane Benson's Story
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new storyline in a Western town, introducing Chane Benson and exploring themes of justice, public perception, and escalating conflict, moving away from Nan and Cal's story.

sub_scenes.title: Cowtown Showdown and Public Opinion
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson's public brawl in Cowtown sparks varied reactions from townspeople, setting the stage for his character introduction and the town's dynamics.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Critical Opinion of Chane Benson
Sally and Older Man's More Mature Perspective on Chane Benson

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Gun Handling and Escalating Argument
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Jeff discuss Clyde, and Sally questions Jeff's gun handling, leading to a heated argument and Jeff's alarming comparison to his brother Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Past Hero Worship and Questioning Gun Handling

sub_scenes.title: Reassurance, Commitment, and Benson's Storytelling
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Clyde reassure each other about Jeff, while Mr. Benson begins to tell a suspenseful story, drawing Sally into a new narrative thread.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance and Commitment to Change Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and Storytelling

sub_scenes.title: Article Accusation and Benson's Threat
sub_scenes.description: Sally confronts Clyde about an article, while also warning him about Benson's threat. Benson himself interjects, reassuring them and revealing his intent to fight against killers.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Denial about the Article
Benson's Declaration to Stay and Fight Killers

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Conflict and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: Benson's threat to Surrett, Clyde's defiant articles, and a shift in public opinion lead to a dinner invitation for Benson, intended as a conciliatory gesture.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Defiant Articles and Public Reaction

sub_scenes.title: Dinner's End, Confrontation, and Showdown
sub_scenes.description: The dinner with Benson ends with polite interactions, but hidden tensions escalate into a confrontation, physical assault, and a final showdown in town.

narrative_arcs.title: End of Dinner and Moonlight Charm
Resolution of the Standoff and Benson's Departure
Reflecting on Tension and Expressing Remorse
Headline Change, Relief, and Newspaper Work

Major_Arcs.title: Range War and Steve Daley's Arrival
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new setting and conflict centered around a range war, focusing on Betsy and the arrival of Steve Daley as her bodyguard, setting up a new set of challenges and characters.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and Bodyguard Introduction
sub_scenes.description: A tense ranch scene with cowboys and the introduction of Steve Daley as Betsy's bodyguard, hinting at impending trouble and conflict related to the range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley as Bodyguard

sub_scenes.title: Clarifying Steve's Role and Range War Concerns
sub_scenes.description: Conversations clarify Steve's role as bodyguard and delve into the specifics of the range war, including cattle troubles and the identified antagonist 'Double-K'.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion of Range War and Underlying Troubles

sub_scenes.title: Store Visit and Confrontation with Bridges
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve's visit to the store leads to observations about Daley and a violent confrontation with Fred Bridges and his men, escalating the range war conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Departure from the Store and Daley's Observation
Confrontation with Fred Bridges and Hired Hand
Observations on Steve's Skills and Impending Danger

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Decision and Maverick's Interest
sub_scenes.description: Betsy decides Steve can stay but not as a gunslinger, while Maverick expresses a personal interest in Betsy, leading to a complex interaction.

narrative_arcs.title: Maverick's Observation and Question to Betsy
Hank Defends Steve and Maverick's Suggestion

Major_Arcs.title: Love, Principles, and Violence in the Range War
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the burgeoning romance between Betsy and Steve, intertwined with the escalating violence of the range war, forcing Betsy to confront her principles and make difficult choices.

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and the Gunslinger Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: Betsy sets a condition for Steve's job, leading to a confession of love and a dilemma regarding Steve's identity as a gunslinger versus Betsy's principles.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Dilemma and Betsy's Confession of Love
Steve's Ultimate Proof of Love and Betsy's Acceptance

sub_scenes.title: Bridges' Confrontation and Betsy's Resolve for Violence
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges confronts Betsy, followed by a direct confrontation with Hank and escalating tensions, leading to Betsy's decision to use guns to protect her ranch.

narrative_arcs.title: Bridges Confronts Hank and Accuses Trespassing
Betsy and Steve Prepare for Confrontation
Betsy Justifies Gun Violence as Necessary
Betsy Recounts the Ambush and Loss of Horses
Aftermath of the Ambush and Hank's Escape

sub_scenes.title: Decision for Guns and Devil's Pass Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Betsy decides to use guns despite Steve's disapproval, leading to a conflict between them and Betsy's journey to Devil's Pass, culminating in gunfire and injury.

narrative_arcs.title: Ride to Devil's Pass and Gunfire Encounter
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Warning

Major_Arcs.title: Dave, Carrie, and Fred's Love Triangle
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new set of characters and a love triangle involving Carrie, Dave, and Fred Gordon, exploring themes of love, deception, and reconciliation in a different romantic context.

sub_scenes.title: Dave and Rancher's Daughter Conflict
sub_scenes.description: A conflict between Dave and the Rancher's daughter, followed by the introduction of a new threat and fence confrontation, initiating a new storyline.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern over Curley and Bear Fenin's Threat

sub_scenes.title: Past Apologies and Carrie's Guilt
sub_scenes.description: Reflection on past apologies and Carrie's lingering guilt and negative feelings towards Fred Gordon, setting up a complex emotional backdrop.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Past Apologies and Lingering Resentment
Carrie's Reluctance to Discuss Fred and Preference for Dave

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation, Sarcasm, and Truce
sub_scenes.description: A confrontation between Carrie and Fred, characterized by sarcasm and confusion, eventually leading to a tentative truce and a movie invitation.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Confrontation and Demand to Leave Dave Alone
Reflection on Love and a Marriage Proposal

sub_scenes.title: Deception, Confrontation, and Surrender
sub_scenes.description: Carrie realizes Fred's proposal might be deceptive and related to business contracts, leading to a confrontation and a surprising surrender from Carrie in Carlton's office.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Deception and Contract Motive
Night of Reflection and Business Meeting

sub_scenes.title: Farewell, Town Rumors, and Love Confession
sub_scenes.description: Carrie bids an angry farewell to Fred, encounters Dave in town amidst rumors, and ultimately confesses her love for Fred to Dave, driven by past advice.

sub_scenes.title: Illness, Revelation, and Joyful Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Carrie falls ill, leading to a revelation about Fred's honorable actions regarding the contract and a joyful reunion and romantic resolution between Carrie and Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Shame, Regret, and Joyful Ride

Major_Arcs.title: Chris and Dirk's Story of Love and Duty
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to Chris and Dirk, exploring their complex relationship amidst violence, duty, and love, culminating in a wedding disrupted by Dirk's unexpected return and a final resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Injury and Doctor's Diagnosis
sub_scenes.description: Dirk arrives injured at Chris's room, followed by a flashback of their past meeting and a doctor's diagnosis of a bullet wound, setting up a crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Past Encounter - Dirk and Chris Meet

sub_scenes.title: Investigation, Sheriff's Arrival, and Ranch Search
sub_scenes.description: Concern for Dirk leads to investigation and the Sheriff's arrival, who insists on searching the ranch, escalating tension and setting up a confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Dirk and Investigation Plan
Sheriff Arrives and Identifies Chris & Dirk's Trail

sub_scenes.title: Arrest, Plea, and Conditional Stay
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Cready interrogates Chris and arrests Dirk, but Chris's plea leads to a conditional stay, creating a temporary truce and emotional tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Plea for Delay and Conditional Stay

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: Chris confesses her love to Marshal Cready, but duty prevails, leading to an escape plan for Dirk and his subsequent arrest by the Marshal.

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Shooting, and Escape to Mexico
sub_scenes.description: The escape attempt leads to pursuit, a flashback of evasion, violent confrontation, shooting, and a desperate escape towards Mexico.

narrative_arcs.title: Fleeing the Scene and Bandaging Wounds
Escape to Mexico and Criminal Escape
Return to Rance and Confession of Love

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Injury and Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Rance is revealed to be injured, leading to Chris's return and a poignant reunion where love is confessed and reciprocated amidst the aftermath of violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Rance and Separate Paths
Arrival in Mexico and Uncertain Reunion
Inquiry About Business and Father's Opinion

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Plans and Dirk's Return at the Wedding
sub_scenes.description: Wedding plans are made, but lingering fears remain. Dirk unexpectedly returns at the wedding, disrupting the ceremony and creating a final moment of tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Vows and Fears Before the Wedding
Backstory of the Man and Rance's Support
